page.title: 19HEADLESS H0RSEMAN OF TYNRON
page.content: Sam Kirkpatrick of Cairneycroft stole over to young Jean Fingland's one moonlit night.On nearing Clonrae a horserider wearing fine armour and jewelled spurs approached him.His fine appearance was marred by his lack of- A HEAD ! Kirkpatrick followed this apparition to Penpont Cross where it dismounted & knelt on the ground searching.After turning to look at a barking dog, Kirkpatrick found the apparition had vanished.This headless horseman is supposedly a young McMilligan who courted the daughter of McGlachan of Dalquhat.Her brother int- errupted their courting & McMilligan stormed off in a rage.Carelessly riding over a steep crag his head was severed from his body and rolled down into St Bride's well. His spirit is still seen in Penpont searching for the head needed to enter heaven.
